inn1.comm: Southee finds swing right away. Pitched up and shapes back in slightly just outside off, pushed back to the bowler off the inside half
full and angling away outside off, no shot offered
Southee errs in line. Full and slipping down leg, some inswing for Southee again. Diverted off the pad fine past the keeper
inswinging yorker, right at the base of middle, Tamim jabs his bat down and negotiates it well enough
good length and slanting away outside off, not a driveable length. The batsman looks for that shot and ends up skewing an inside edge to mid-on
Southee nails another inswinging yorker, Tamim falls over, but manages to keep it out
tossed up on off, no turn, played back to the bowler
slides on middle and leg, the batsman hangs back and works the ball to short fine leg
pushed through on middle, makes some room and jabs the ball to mid-off
tossed full on middle, good control from Patel. This is driven wide of mid-off; first runs off the bat

miscommunication between the wickets. There was never a run there. Never. Faster and flatter, Tamim squirts it behind square a few feet to the right of the keeper, and sets off. He is sent back by his partner. Ronchi can't effect a direct hit, and Tamim gets away. He throws a stare at Kayes, not sure why. It was Tamim who was too jumpy too soon
skids on outside off, Tamim aims a cover-drive. Goes hard and ends up getting an inside edge to midwicket
full and angling away outside off, swinging away. Tamim slashes a drive and sends an outside edge flying past wide slip, fine of short third man
Southee brings this one back into the left-hander. He falls over the flick and takes it on the pad
Southee aims another inswinging yorker. Has to settle with a full-toss on off, which is punched away firmly to the left of mid-on
good length on middle, played back to the bowler
very full and wide outside off, Tamim reaches out and slices a drive off the outside half straight to short third man
back of a length and angling away outside off, ignored
back of a length and angling away outside off, this sits in the surface and messes up with the batsman's drive. Chipped just wide of short extra cover. Seems like a sluggish surface
good length on middle, not much early movement for Henry, tapped back to him
might full and outside off, angles his bat and squeezes out to backward point
good length on off, punched more or less straight to short extra cover
short and wide outside off,  Kayes throws his bat at the ball and flays it over backward point. Third man, who is now in the deep, mops it up, running to his left
good length and angling across off, left alone
banged in short on middle and leg, cramps the batsman for room. Fended to the square-leg region
bouncer on leg stump, sails over to the keeper, Kayes lets it pass
follows it with a full ball outside off, front-foot drive to the left of mid-off. Williamson hunts the ball down
rising delivery, angling away outside off, dabbed with soft hands past wide slip
back of a length and outside off, punched out to point
short and skids on just outside off and bounces past the awful slash of  Tamim. Cross-seamer from Southee. Too close for the cut
back of a length and outside off, opens the face and glides it to point
back of a length and outside off, stands tall and punches it square through the off side, backward point had no chance
whipped away to the left of mid-on was this was too straight in line
full and outside off, leans forward and drives to mid-off
118.1ks offcutter, ends on off or just outside. The batsman spots it and blocks gently on the front foot
full and straight, whipped to mid-on. Kayes was a bit slow, but the fielder could not nail a direct hit to pose a threat
very full and angling away outside off, jabbed to mid-off off the inside half for another scampered single
dug in short on middle, sits up to be hit. Kayes rocks back and puts it away to the square leg boundary with a pull
bouncer outside off, skids on, Imrul lets it pass over to the keeper
follows it with a full ball that goes straight on outside off, left alone
short and angling away outside off, arches his back and leaves
short and wide outside off, skips back and punches it sweetly. Hits it in the air but in the gap at point
full and outside off, sliced down to Southee at third man
banged in short on middle, tests Tamim with a shoulder-high short ball. Top-edged pull in the air to the left of short midwicket
keeps it short on middle, fended to cover on the back foot
very full on middle and leg, played back to the bowler
dug short on leg stump, swivels and pulls to long leg for two more
very full on the stumps, driven to the right of cover
good length and angling away outside off, Kayes ushers it through to the keeper
full and outside off, floats through to the keeper, left alone again
back of a length and outside off, Kayes attempts a reckless slash and misses
short and angling away outside off, stands up tall and crunches it to point. Punched away
back of a length on off, played back to the bowler
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted away to point
pitched up on the stumps, driven back to the bowler on the front foot
short and down the leg side, misses the glance. Wide
very full and angling away outside off, dab-and-run single to point. Broom under-arm flicks it onto the stumps, but the bails refuse to budge
full and outside off, run down to third man
good length on middle, driven away to the left of midwicket for a couple
slower full ball on the pads, whipped away to short fine leg
back of a length and outside off, back-foot force to the off side. Guptill throws himself to his right from short cover to stop the ball
what a welcome to the bowling crease for Neesham. Friendly half-volley in the mid 120s on middle, Tamim power a delightful straight drive that races past the bowler even before he could react
dabs it to the off side, the non-striker took off for a run, only to be sent back. It helped that there was no direct hit at the bowler's end
short on middle and leg, he helps it along towards fine leg
good length delivery outside off, pushed to extra cover
floats this much fuller on off stump from wide of the crease, gets half-forward and blocks
nips away a hint from off stump, Imrul defends to the off side again. Neat end to the over after that bullet drive first up
drifting down leg, Tamim misses a faint tickle, Ronchi half-stops that
gets some bat on that in-drifter that rolls to short fine leg as they complete a quick single
tossed up on middle and leg, he gets forward and defends to the leg side
eased with the spin to wide long-off as they jog the single
shapes to cut but this one skids back in to cramp him for room and hits the top part of the bat. Could have been dangerous
slides down leg, this one deflects off the pad past short fine leg
ferocious sweep, but just for one as it rolls straight to deep square. He fetched it from well outside off
drops it into the off side gently, makes eye contact with the non-striker and off they go for the single. 140 clicks from Neesham on that occasion
driven but straight to extra cover. Went really hard at that, got the toe end of the bat
crunched but straight to deep point this time
short of length delivery that straightens from middle, he's squared up slightly in defense
wow, he's clobbered that into the grass banks at wide long-on. Too full, he walks across the stumps and heaves it to the leg side. In total control
swings north, ball goes south. Throws his bat at a full and wide delivery, gets a thick edge that runs into the third man boundary
worked with the spin to the bowler
gets forward and across to ease it back down the pitch again
full on middle and leg, nurdled towards fine leg
drifts down leg, Tamim goes back into the crease to tuck it fine
goes onto the back foot and works it to square leg
fetches the sweep from outside off towards deep square leg
pushed through quicker on middle from around the stumps, he gets forward and deadbats that
slider on middle, pushed to the off side
skids back in to cramp him for room, defended to the leg side
get an inside-edge back down the pitch as he stabs at that in-drifter

super sweep, a terrible effort at deep square leg from Santner. Dives over the ball. He got a bad bounce, but should have still been stopped. He fetched it from outside off and picked the bones out of it
quicker on off, eased wide of cover for a quick single
tossed up on middle, pushed to mid-on
full and straight on middle, defended back to the bowler
slow turn on middle and leg, tucked to fine leg
this one starts on leg and spins back in to leave the keeper to collect down leg
firm push to midwicket, no chance of a single
gets forward and works it past mid-on for an easy single again
quicker and fuller on off from around the stumps, defended to the off side
steps out and defends back to the bowler
steps out but the bowler sees that and fired it down leg, Tamim readjusts and blocks with his bat very close to the pad
slows it down nicely, lands it at length on off, eased wide of cover
nice flight, solid push to cover, a misfield that deflects to mid-off gives them a single
slider on middle and leg, worked with the angle to short fine leg
easy pickings, full and down leg, paddled round the corner to fine leg
punched to short midwicket
shapes to play a reverse sweep, but Santner fires it short and across, he quickly changes his stroke and blocks

Neesham misses a run-out chance from square leg at the bowler's end. Tamim turns it to the leg side, calls for the single and then stops. Kayes was down a long way and turned awkwardly. Direct hit would have made it very interesting there.  Kayes fell on his elbow and is getting some medical attention.  b>
tossed up on off, nearly yorked himself but somehow managed to squeeze that to long-on
slider outside off, punched down to long on again
goes for a lofted hit over cover, but checks his shot in the end, eases it along the ground instead, to deep point
gets to the pitch of the ball and defends it back to the bowler
drifter on middle and leg, turned behind square for a quick single
tosses up one on middle, pushed back to the bowler
tucked behind square on the leg side again
quality shot! Steps out, moves to the leg side and then lofts it inside-out over cover. Couple of bounces into the fence
steps out and swings leg side, got the full toss high on the bat, so couldn't generate the power and timing that he would have liked
full and flat on middle and leg, worked to square leg
gets forward and wrists it down to long on
waits for the ball to spin back in as he turns it between midwicket and square leg
firm push down to long-on as they jog the single
shortens his length this time, slides this across the batsman who shows the full face of the bat in defence
Tamim dances out, Patel pushes it short on middle, hit back to the bowler
guided to backward point from off stump. Diving save from the fielder
slider outside off, deft little dab from Tamim. Employs the latest of late dabs and sends it fine past the keeper, through vacant slip. Nice way to bring up the century stand
Tamim races down the track and hacks the ball to the covers
skids on, no turn, Tamim eyes the leg side and takes it on the pad
flatter and quicker, Patel hits the pad again. This was heading down leg, though
tossed up outside off, driven down the ground

Broom plucks out a stunning one-handed catch to break the century opening stand. NZ needed some brilliance and Broom provides it. He runs back and across to his right from short third man and grabs it, tumbling onto the ground. Kayes runs down the track, Santner pulls his length back. The batsman goes for a wild leg-side slog and ends up skying a catch. That it was a catch was down to Broom's agility
pretty full and outside off, driven through the covers
flatter and faster on the pads, whipped out to square leg
sliding across the left-hander, glided through vacant slips
dropped short and outside off, but this keeps low and defeats the cut shot of Tamim
pitched up on off, push-driven to mid-off
full and outside off, patted to the covers
full and wide outside off, slashes a cut square through the off side. Sweet piece of timing
bumper on the leg stump, ducks under. Too high and called a wide
this is even better from Sabbir. Half-volley outside off, Sabbir presses forward and drills a drive through the covers.

what a response from Henry. Pings Sabbir on the chest. Dug in short, kicks at the batsman, he leaps to ride the bounce, but this one skidded on and defeated him. Yikes, Sabbir now goes down and grimaces in pain. The physio, I believe, is out to tend to him
flighted on middle and leg, driven to the left of the bowler
short on middle and leg, goes back and punches through midwicket. Raises his half-century
slides in with the arm on off, defended back to the bowler
darted outside off, nearly 94ks, forced to the covers
tossed up slower and outside off, Sabbir goes after it. He attempts a slog-sweep and sends a top-edge over backward square leg. Southee runs across to his right from deep square to cut that off
length and outside off, run away to cover
Tamim races down the track..... and leaves the ball. Henry adjusted his length and dragged it short and wide outside off. Tamim pulled out of the shot in the end
short and wide outside off, shimmies out and flays the ball to sweeper cover
shortish and outside off, Sabbir was not in control of the pull, (mis)hitting it in the air over midwicket
and it continues. But this is a soft short ball. Waist-high delivery outside off, pulls it powerfully over wide mid-on
Henry gets carried away. Banged short and down leg, ducks under.  Wide

Sabbir has been strangled down the leg side. The short ball works for Henry and NZ. Shoulder-high short ball on the leg stump or just outside, cramping the batsman for room. Sabbir attempted to glance it fine, but only ended up gloving to Ronchi. Two wickets in four overs for NZ
greets him with a bouncer, the leg-slip stays, ducks under it
full and angled across off, driven down to long-on
looped up on off, pushed to short cover
slid in on leg stump, tickled to short fine leg
much slower through the air outside off, check-driven square through the off side for a single
hip-high short ball outside off, the left-hander ventures deep in the crease and swats the ball to long-on
skids on outside off, forced to point
short on off, pulled away around the corner to long leg
back of a length and outside off, angled down to third man

Spooned to short midwicket. The short ball now gets Mahmudullah. Hip-high ball, not as threatening as the one that nabbed Sabbir. The line is outside off. He pulls in the air, probably plays early, and picks out Neesham. Mahmudullah will leave the series with scores of 0,1,3
very full and outside off, driven to cover
short and wide outside off, cracked to point on the back foot
length and outside off, left alone
short and outside off, hit back to Kane
full on middle, driven back to the bowler on the front foot
leans back and chops to cover
good length on middle, played back to the bowler
slides on outside off, he nearly picked it off the keeper's gloves, late-cutting it very fine of short third man
flat on leg stump, goes low and sweeps behind the square-leg umpire
wild delivery outside off, wide
slower offcutter, driven back to the bowler
dug in short and outside off, beats Tamim's attempted pull
full and outside off, square-driven away
pushed to the covers
dug short on off pulled behind square on the leg side
full and outside off, belted back to the bowler
slides past the outside edge, slash and a miss outside off
very full and outside off, driven to the covers
another one that slides past the outside edge. Rolls on outside off. Shakib is caught on the crease, plays for turn and is beaten
short and wide outside off, square-cut to deep point on the back foot
backs away outside leg and drives it inside-out through cover-point
fired outside off, inside-edged to midwicket

as far as shots go, you have to say that is an absolute shocker from a senior player. Bangladesh wobbling big time. Tamim looks for a ugly slog across the line to a length delivery, only manage a top edge that was swirling in the air for a long time. Broom, running backwards from point, kept his eyes on the ball and then plucked out what could have been a toughie. He's made it look really easy in the end.
floats this full and across the left-hander, who drives to cover
outstanding one-handed stop at point. He got onto his toes and cracked that off the back foot, Broom's the man again lurking around the corner
right into the blockhole, nearly at the base of off stump, Shakib jams his bat down in time to keep that out
looks to pull over midwicket, gets it on the top half of the bat and the ball just manages to lob over mid-on. Risky shot. Not really worth it given the situation they're in
this time, he's so much more in control. Picks the length early, swivels back and pulls in front of square to deep midwicket
opens the bat face late to steer a flighted delivery to deep cover as he jog the single
full toss on middle and leg, eased down to long-on
too full outside off, squeezed to cover
beaten by sharp turn. This one drifts in and cuts away sharply, too full for Shakib to attempt a cut
forced off the back foot behind point
quicker delivery on middle and leg, nurdled to square leg
not much width for him to drive on the up, gets a thick inside edge back down the pitch
uppish and between cover and point, down to the boundary rider
slips a length ball in from wide of the crease, Mosaddek hangs back inside the crease and defends with minimal feet movement
pulled, and pulled well. Nearly a tennis shot, that. Left leg in the air as he fetched it from outside off. That's more like a slap. Looks good when it comes off
how does the bowler respond next? Digs a rip roaring bouncer in on middle, Mosaddek does well to sway out of the way. Way over the batsman's head, the umpire feels
works off his hips behind square for an easy single
full and straight on middle, eased past Neesham's outstretched hands on his follow-through
swung across the line against turn, didn't get hold of it, on the bounce to mid-on
gets forward and eases it to cover
blocks a quicker one off the back foot
prods forward and deadbats a flighted delivery on middle
opens the bat face to steer that full delivery behind point
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it with the spin to long on
delicate little late cut, waits for it to spin back in before lending direction, to short third man
slider on middle and leg, defends from the crease
cramped for room, whips an in-drifter to deep square leg
slides one on off, he eases it behind point
worked off his hip into the leg side, keeper runs across to cut that off
slips one down leg side, worked to short fine leg
"don't mind that, Kane," say Ronchi. This was nicely tossed up, there was a hint of width too, Shakib stepped out and muscled that across the line into the long-on boundary
flatter in trajectory, punched to long-off this time
forced off the back foot to the point fielder
gets to the pitch of the ball and eases it to sweeper cover
slow turn from off stump, bunted back to the bowler
cuts, and cuts well but straight to the man at deep point

works this to the leg side and scoots off for the run, Ronchi runs quickly to his right, picks up the ball and flicks that underarm in one motion. Shakib, who was coasting for the run, had to suddenly hurry up, but he'd lost valuable time in between as the throw hit the stumps direct. Moments of magic like these can make a big, big difference. Bangladesh's slide continues.
gets forward and across, works it with the spin to long-on
skids straight on, Nurul is beaten as he played for the turn
runs that wide of short third man to get off the mark

simple, simple decision for the umpire. Mosaddek plays all around a straight ball on middle. That would have crashed into the stumps. Mosaddek has a chat with his partner and then walks off without reviewing.
this is short, plenty of width on it as well, Tanbir cuts it to deep point
fired full on middle and leg from wide of the crease, turned to the leg side
gets forward and eases the full ball to the off side
firm push to mid-off
fired full and straight on middle, squeezed back to the bowler
deceived by the drift, looks to defend leg side, ball rolls off the outer half of the bat, back to the bowler
stabs with the bat in front of the bat, gets an edge to short third man.  Maiden over from the skipper
a misfield from Guptill at mid-on results in a single. A clean pick up and a run-out was on, surely
defended back down the pitch. Played for the turn when there was none again
drops it into the off side where point would be, keeper runs across to stop that
neat, little ramp. Didn't have the pace but directed it superbly over the keeper's head. Handy runs those
there's bit of drift, this was a legspinner from Jeetan. The batsman didn't read it off the hand but he was struck way outside leg stump.
dabs it to short third man, a rocket throw comes in
worked with the spin to long-on as they jog the single
stays inside the crease and eases a full ball to the off side
gets a thick inside edge on the drive to short midwicket
eased past the bowler to long-on for an easy single

beaten by a drifter again. This one's fired in from wide of the crease, the ball spins back in a touch to beat the inside edge and crash into the stumps. Poor application and the slide continues. This has been another shocking collapse. Who would have thought spin would come back to haunt Bangladesh away from home?
gets forward and pats the incoming delivery
looped up on off, defended with an open face
skiddy delivery on off, kept out
slower through the air on off, Nurul pre-meditates a scoop, and ends up shovelling the ball over the keeper
whipped from off stump to midwicket
down the track and push-driven to long-on
full and just a shade outside off, pushed to the covers. Patel finishes with 1 for 40 on return
tossed full on middle, flicked to midwicket
tapped through square to point
non-turning offbreak on off, played back to the bowler
rank long hop on leg stump, instead of smashing it away, the batsman only tickles it off the glove to fine leg
length and outside off, flat-batted away to long-on
hangs back and works it to the right of midwicket
slower through the air on off, down the track and whipped down to long-on
slides on outside off, crunched through the covers
arrowed in with the arm, short, tucked away through square leg
tossed outside off, driven past the bowler's left to long-off
arm-ball, hurries into off, inside-edged onto the pad
another arm-ball, hurries on, dragged to leg off an inside edge
short on off, hip-high ball, shovel-pulled away to the right of square leg
full slower ball outside off, 96.8ks, chopped down to third man
short and outside off, pulled away behind square leg
length ball on off, tap and run single to cover
slower offcutting short ball on off, Nurul adjusts to the pace or the lack of it, pulling it to the midwicket fence
short and outside off swatted away square through the leg side. There is protection in the deep
down the track, yorks himself, and squirts an outside edge to short third man
arm-ball, fired in on off. Dabbed with soft hands to cover
shortish and outside off, slapped away to cover, where the fielder fumbles
lobbed up on off, bends forward and pushes to cover
uses his feet, eyes the leg side with a flick, but is struck on the pad outside off
slid in very full on off, driven down to long-on
ripping inswinging yorker, ends on middle, jammed down towards mid-on
full-toss now, swerves in on the leg stump, inside-edged onto the pad
leg-stump full-toss, which is flicked away to deep midwicket
slower offcutter just outside off, Mashrafe winds up, waits for the ball to arrive, and flat-bats it down the ground
not an accurate yorker, very full and shapes in, jammed out towards the midwicket region
Southee nails another inswinging yorker, dug out
uses his feet and drives to long-on

Holes out to long-off running to his left. Mashrafe charges down the track, the bowler shortens his length outside off, ensuring the batsman does not get close to the pitch. Bangladesh's captain attempts a loft and finds Patel in the deep
speared on a length on middle, played back to the bowler
floated full and outside off, pushed to the off side
pushed through down the leg side, tickled fine past the keeper
uses his feet, Santner held it back, causing the ball to dip late in its flight. 77ks, knocked to leg
bouncer on off, zings through to the keeper, as Nurul bails out of the hook. Wide
very full on leg, directed to long leg
slower bouncer, cuts away outside off, dupes Taskin who spars at it and is beaten neck and crop
short and angling away outside off, Taskin drops his wrists on it
back of a length and outside off, punched into the covers
short ball on the leg stump, Taskin pulls and skews a top-edge over the keeper. Probably an offcutter from Southee
Nurul pre-meditates and scoops it in the air over the keeper's head. Length and outside off, Nurul sends it over the keeper's head
full and outside off, glided down to third man via an open face
full and slower outside off, now it's Nurul turn to dab it down to third man
yorker just outside off, jammed out to point
full and too straight, whipped away behind square on the leg side

wide yorker outside off, late-cut down to third man. Confusion between the wickets. Nurul wants the second, Taskin isn't interested, then presses on. The throw is to the keeper's end. Nurul is home. Ronchi collects the ball and ferries it to Southee. By then a struggling Taskin is also home
short on middle, swatted away to square-ish long leg
length ball on off, right in the slot, slower one. Nurul picked it and mowed it over midwicket
this is even better from Nurul. Chest-high short ball on off or just outside off. He dares to hook and pastes it over deep backward square leg

excellent catch from Henry running back and across to his right. Sprawling take. Slower cutter outside off, Nurul now swings early and skews it in the air off the toe-end. Fine knock from Nurul nevertheless
slower bouncer, pulls early and nearly swings himself off his feet
wide yorker outside off, slashes and does not connect
Henry slips in another cheeky slower one outside off, Mustafiz swipes early and misses. Bangladesh sneak in a bye

inn2.comm: big lbw appeal first up. Mashrafe gets a length ball to cut back in, Guptill looks to play across the line but gets a thick inside edge.
stands tall and defends a back of length delivery to cover
that's the Bangladesh's version of swings north, goes to Savar. Swings leg side at an away-going length ball, it flies over the slip cordon. Lucky runs
back of length delivery outside off, he mistimes a pull to mid-on
angles a length ball across the batsman, who watches it through to the keeper
on the pads, looks to clip it fine but the ball deflects off the pads to fine leg
starts well. Gets this one to jag back in from length on off stump, Latham gets on top of the bounce and turns it to the leg side
short of length ball that cuts back in from outside off, bunted to the off side
too short and put away. Swiveled back and just helped it along into the deep backward square leg boundary
gets forward and works the incoming delivery from wide of the crease to the leg side

he's struck in his first over, and that roar says it all. Latham commits the cardinal sin of trying to work a full ball across the line, but the ball skidded on which meant he was struck on the pad by the time the bat came down. That as as plumb as it can get. Umpire Shamduddin won't have too many easier decisions to make.
firm push off the front foot to extra cover

punches it wide of mid-off and scampers a run. He was pushed deep into the crease, so had to really hustle his way through.  Guptill has pulled his hamstring in the process and is in some serious pain.  The physio is out attending to him. You just knew halfway through the run that all wasn't fine.
gets on top of that length ball and punches it to cover

have they snuffed him down leg side?  The appeal was so confident  that you'd think they would refer immediately. But no. Surely a bluff? This was sliding down, very close to the glove as he looks to tickle it fine, but there was nothing.
back of length delivery outside off, left alone

that's simply caressed through cover, but the bigger talking point about that delivery is that  Martin Guptill pulled up again while running across and is quickly walking back to the dressing room.  Coming back to the delivery, this was full outside off, not much swing and Williamson just leant forward and eased that through the off side.
gets onto his toes and turns it to the leg side
full and angling in from wide of the crease, he defends that down the pitch with a straight bat
angles a cutter across Broom, who defends from the crease
slants a length ball across the batsman, who watches it through to the keeper
slower and fuller outside off, he gets half-forward and taps it to the off side
squared up by one that nips away late from length on middle, but he adjusts well to defend it back down the pitch

dropped.  Oh, dear. This was a cracking delivery that deserved another wicket. The angle doing the trick. Broom, completely squared up, just fended at that. It came through too slowly to Imrul Kayes, who puts down a dolly at first slip.
stays inside the crease and defend that length delivery to the leg side
back of length delivery on middle and leg, punched to midwicket
slides a fuller delivery on middle and leg, defended to the on side
cut away into the gap between cover and point. Not timed all that well enough
gets this one to come back in off the seam, Williamson falls over a little as he defends that
too late in his attempt to whip that off his hip, the ball deflects off the thigh pad to square leg and they scamper a run
floats this full, the ball swerves away from off stump, he's solidly behind the line in defense
angles a half-volley across the batsman, who eases it to cover
slower and fuller outside off, Williamson lets it go
stays inside the crease and opens the bat face late to steer it between slip and gully
stands tall and punches a short of length delivery on off stump to mid-off
wrists the short of length delivery on middle to the leg side
gets stuck into the pitch and cuts away sharply, there's a hint of awkward bounce too as Broom withdraws his bottom hand off the grip and they take a run off a deflection to third man
gets forward and bunts a full delivery with a straight bat
excellent take down the leg side. Sliding down towards the eighth stump or so, Nurul takes a couple of steps to his left and them flings himself to stop that
goes for a full-blooded pull but the ball thuds into his thigh pad. Broom late on the stroke again. Square leg came swooping in
this time it's called wide. Angles this down leg side, keeper dives full length forward to take it on the full
works it exactly through that area now. Vacant square leg means midwicket has to run across to cut that off, but they can't prevent the second
punched off the back foot to cover
leans forward and steers the full delivery to backward point
this is slower and much fuller on middle, pushed to cover
angles an off-cutter across Williamson, there's extra bounce because of the over-spin, Williamson takes his bottom hand off the grip as he jabs at that
defends the away-going length ball to the off side with soft hands
slower and fuller on middle and leg, Williamson shows the full face of the bat in defence
another cutter, predictable yet batsmen unable to line him up. Williamson adjusts late to bunt that to the off side.
punched to mid-off, calls 'wait' immediately
another slower delivery, Williamson plays too early and nearly ends up lobbing it back to Mustafizur

big, big appeal first up.  So convincing that you'd again think they'd review, but no. Mashrafe hints the ball would have missed the stumps. Credit to the bowler for hustling him for pace. Broom was on his toes as he tried to whip that away. Enough hint that the ball would have gone over.
width on offer, cut to square third man
misfield at short midwicket allows a single that shouldn't have been
pushed back down the pitch, Taskin didn't quite stop it cleanly on his followthrough. Lucky for Williamson, at the non-striker's end, that it didn't deflect onto the stumps
solid timing, impeccable wrist work. Fetches it from middle and off towards midwicket
leg-stump half-volley that has been flicked to deep square leg
full on the pads, worked into the gap behind square for a couple
in-drifter from wide of the crease, whipped to deep square leg
prods outside the line of the delivery and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad
beautiful shot! Not all that short, but he committed himself to go back and punch that into the gap. Perfect execution
and again. Drops it short this time, Williamson rocks back, opens up the off side field and cracks that between cover and point
too full on the pads, works it down to mid-on for a quick single
short on middle and leg, Williamson skips back and pulls to long leg. The Fizz hunts it down in the deep
full and outside off, pushed back down the pitch
shortish and outside off, chopped away to the covers
good length on off, punched to the man at mid-on
back of a length and outside off, not a pullable length. It did not bounce as much as the batsman expected. Beaten
back of a length on the stumps, he reads the length well enough and punches down the ground to the left of mid-on
skids in on off, defended
tossed full and outside off, driven down to long-off
much slower outside off, hint of turn, Kane gets forward and taps it to the covers
good length and drifts in, worked to short midwicket
Broom skips out, Shakib fires it quicker and shorter, inside-edged behind to the right of the keeper
back of a length and angled in on middle, punched back to the bowler
short and outside off, nails a cut, and finds point
short and angled in, defended
back of a length and just outside off, chopped behind point
length ball on off, gets forward and pushes to mid-off
back of a length and outside off, the batsman is on the move as he punches back to the bowler
tossed up on off, played back to the bowler with a straight bat
down the track and drilled to mid-on, who fumbles allowing the single
uses his feet and drives a single to long-off
Classy from Kane. Gallops down the track, meets the pitch, extends his arms and lofts it regally over the bowler's head
Kane twinkles down the track again, takes a half-volley and drives it straight, this time all along the ground
slightly short on off, pulled to deep square
chopped to deep point
good length and outside off, run away to the covers
very full on middle, driven down to long-on
tossed outside off, turns away, driven through the covers on the front foot, and that's drinks
short and outside off, Kane leaps, rises on top of the bounce and square-cuts it away to the left of backward point. He's nailing it today... well, like most days
and Kane hits the repeat button despite the addition of an extra fielder at point. Not as short as the previous ball, Kane now crouches a touch and lashes it, splitting the two fielders
good length on off, Kane plays late and dabs it towards point
good length and outside off, pushed to point
very full and outside off, driven to mid-off
short and angled in, tucked around the corner
slides on outside off, Williamson dabs a cut to short third man
slower legbreak outside off, square-cut towards deep point
lobs a full-toss outside off, punched to long-off
rank half-tracker on middle, sits up on this Saxton Oval surface. Rocks back and cracks a pull to the midwicket fence
very full and outside off, makes a bit of room, and drives to the left of extra cover
fired on off stump, cut away to sweeper cover
full on middle, defended
slower cutter on leg stump, 107ks, nudged behind square on the leg side. Just a single
glanced off the hips to long leg
full on middle and leg, defended
leg-side wide
good length and cutting away outside off helped down to third man
picked off the pads through backward square leg
short and slides in, stands tall and punches a single to long-on
arm ball, comes in, forced down the ground on the back foot
slower through the air on middle and leg, nurdled to square leg
Kane shimmies out, this one comes in with the arm and takes the pad. Heading down leg with the angle
whipped away through midwicket
full and outside off, driven to sweeper cover
short and just outside off, quelled to the off side
inside-edged to midwicket
short on off, leaps and plays to midwicket
cutter on middle, 107.2ks, dabbed with soft hands to cover
short and down leg, Broom simply helps it fine enough on the leg side
slower offcutter, 111.4ks. The batsman camps back and blocks
too full on off stump, he leans forward and defends to cover
27th ODI fifty for the NZ captain.  This one is a gentle chip down the ground followed by a nurdle past the bowler
flatter on middle and leg, he whips it to deep square leg as they jog the single

slows this down nicely but the direction was down leg side, he stays inside the crease and turns it to the leg side. The keeper is alert to put his left glove out to stop the ball and whip the bails, but the back foot was firmly grounded
whipped to deep square
tossed up on the stumps, defended back down the pitch
slides this one down the leg side, Nurul get a bit of glove on it as he moves swiftly to his left. There was a little bit of pad involved too
too full on middle and leg, worked to mid-on
gets to the pitch of the ball and works it to midwicket
easy pickings. Too full and down leg, Broom gets down on one knee and sweeps that one powerfully past short fine leg.
this time he sweeps it to the left of short fine, down to deep backward square leg
half-tracker which he could have deposited wherever he pleased, Williamson rocks back and pulls straight to deep midwicket
gets to the pitch of the ball and defends
too short, he rocks back, frees his arms and crashes that behind point. Delightful timing, even better placement. Top stuff, this
leans into the drive, eases it past the bowler to long-off
punched to Shakib's right, he does well to half-stop that
drifts this into middle and leg, punched down to long-on for an easy single
gets too close to the pitch of the ball, as a result of which he can't drive freely. Squeezes the full delivery back to Shakib
top work at mid-on, it was struck firmly
rocks back and punches the short ball to sweeper cover
slider on middle and leg, tucked wide of short midwicket
this one gets stuck into the pitch and spins away sharply to square him up and take a leading edge, lobs between cover and point as they sneak a single
flatter on middle and leg, whipped to midwicket
makes a bit of room and punches the short ball back past the bowler
slides a length ball into the pads, worked to fine leg
too short outside off, pure wrist work from the batsman to whip it towards deep square leg

oh dear, a tardy effort at fine leg results in a boundary. Shouldn't have been more than a single there. Broom backs up a century with a fifty. This one's a back of length delivery on middle and leg, and he's whipped it superbly. Powerful forearms. Was given a reprieve early in the innings by Kayes, and he's made it count
turns it wide of midwicket
dabs it towards third man for an easy single
angles a length ball into the pads, worked to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, driven sweetly off the front foot to sweeper cover, Broom briefly thought of the second
slider on middle and leg, swept to deep midwicket
too short, he rocks back and cuts that into the gap between deep cover and point
leans forward and punches it past the bowler to long-off
once again makes a bit of room to free his arms and ease that to long-off

as powerful as sweep shots come! Too full and down leg, Broom gets down on one knee very quickly and times the sweep brilliantly towards deep backward square leg. No chance for the fielder even though he was just a few yards away from the ball
too full outside off, crashed off the front foot into the gap at sweeper cover
full and swingng away from off stump, he gets outside the line of the stumps and defends
gets this one to jag back in off the seam, Williamson walks across the stump and turns it to the leg side
sharp bouncer, invites the pull by asking the batsman to fetch it from outside off, Williamson, who walked down the pitch, eventually sways out of the way

induces the nick but it doesn't carry.  Excellent change of pace, Williamson is deceived, tries to run it down to third man but this was too full as well. The ball was on the way down as Nurul gives forward and stops that
pulled all along the ground to deep square leg
full on middle and leg, pushed to long-on
flatter one on middle and leg, worked to deep square leg
this is very poor. Too short outside off, Williamson rocks back and then opens the bat face late to steer it into the gap at deep point
cuts but on the bounce to short third man
loopy delivery outside off, punched back to the bowler
full on middle and leg, worked to midwicket
dabs a length ball on off stump to point
delightful little flick shot that bounces away into the midwicket boundary. Too full, and he simply used his wrists to lift that one bounce over the ropes.
slow off-cutter this time, defended towards the man coming in from point
half-stop at point means they can't prevent a single
Not out is the call. Williamson swayed out of the way of that short ball, before the keeper flicked an under-arm throw at the bowler's end
short and down leg, way over Williamson's head. He was giving th charge
full on middle and leg, he shuffles across and nudges it to short midwicket
goes for an expansive drive as the room was there, only manages a thick edge that races into the third man boundary. Lucky runs but he'll take those nonetheless
shapes to cut but gets a bottom edge that rolls back to the bowler

he's butchered that! Boy, that has raced into the boundary at the rate of knots. At length outside off, he gets down on one knee and swats it away with disdain, no chance either for long on or deep midwicket
full toss on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
slow turn back in from outside off, defended back to the bowler
pushed through outside off, tapped through cover
terrific shot from Williamson. He backs away outside leg and comes down the track. Meets the pitch of this flighted ball and deliciously drives it inside-out over extra cover
arrowed through at the pads of the batsman, flicked through midwicket
full on middle and leg, swept away to deep square leg
slightly short and angled in on off, stands tall and punches solidly to long-on
dug in short and outside off, Williamson has ample time to skip back and pull in front of square
good length and angled in, dabbed into the covers with gentle hands
full on off, Williamson plays late, gliding the ball to point
shortish and outside off, Williamson gets on top of the bounce and punches the ball straight to point
back of a length and outside off, keeps a bit low and beats Williamson's attempted cut
full on off, whipped to mid-on
flighted outside off, moves forward and drives to cover
full and angling in, the batsman sweeps and misses, going down leg with the angle
tossed up on off, guided to point
Broom fetches this from outside off and slog-sweeps it brutally over midwicket for a six
Broom now employs finesse, dinking a full ball to point
pitched up and outside off, no turn, driven to the left of extra cover
pretty full on off, whipped away to long-on
too short and he's fetched that from outside off to hammer that in front of square. Super timing
this time it's too wide outside off, he deliberately opens the face of the bat to steer it into the third man boundary
back of a length and just outside off, punched back to the bowler
back of a length on off, not there for the cut. Broom chops the ball beside his feet
flicked off the pads to long leg

Broom had to wait 2910 days for his maiden ODI hundred. He had a chance to make it two ODI hundreds in three days but he misses it. Loops a catch to gully, Mashrafe dives and pouches it. Cutter from Mustafizur, finds extra bounce, and dupes Broom. He drives early and falls three short of three figures
short and outside off, stabbed to cover
back of a length and hugging the off stump, drop-and-run single behind towards the keeper
back of a length, slower offcutter at 108ks, grips in the surface, defended
back of a length on the stumps, defended
fired on off, played back to the bowler
Neesham can swing and swing cleanly. Floated up outside off, he goes across the line, launching the ball over midwicket
whipped away to square leg
flighted and outside off, dabbed towards point via an open face
down the track and quietly blocked back to the bowler
slugged from outside off to deep midwicket
length and outside off, steered down to third man
back of a length and cuts back in on off stump, grips in the surface. Defended
follows it with another slower full one, nudged away through square leg
back of a length and outside off, Williamson defends towards point
cutter outside off, opens the face and runs the ball to gully
short and outside off, steered to third man running to his right
pushed back to the bowler
full-toss on middle, clipped to deep midwicket
floated up on the leg stump, knocked to square leg. They hare off for a single and take a second thanks to an overthrow
skids on outside off. Defended
back of a length and outside off, leans back and chops to the covers
length-ball offbreak on off, bunted down the ground
good length cutter pitches on leg and moves away outside off, Williamson waits, waits... and then late-cuts to third man
full on middle, defended
banged in short on off, Williamson camps back and fends it back to the bowler
back of a length on off, blocked on the back foot
slower ball on the pads, cutter, 106ks, glanced to long leg
back of a length and outside off, Neesham chops a single to third man
pushed through on off, no turn, defended on the back foot to the bowler
flatter and quicker outside off, back-foot punch to the covers
short on off, forced to midwicket
slightly short and outside off, pulled away to long-on
very full on off, driven to long-on past the bowler's right
slog-swept from outside off to cow corner, Kayes runs around and makes a mess of it. Concedes four
short and outside off, pulled away to the right of mid-on. The fielder manfully chases and cuts it off to three
bouncer outside off, flies over the attempted hook. Wide called
short on middle and leg, cramps him for room. Neesham flinches and fends to midwicket
half-volley outside off, drills a drive, mid-off dives to his right and makes a half-stop
banged in short and outside off, swivels and controls a pull behind square for a boundary
short on middle, hops and fends
full on leg stump, chipped in front of short midwicket
ah, Williamson backs away outside leg, meets a cutter, and dinks a single down to third man
length ball outside off, Neesham clouts it over wide mid-on and secures New Zealand's 3-0 sweep.
